instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SSD_PWR_EN: What is SSD_PWR_EN? SSD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip making the power rail for the SSD to turn on when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.SSD_RESET_CONN_L: What is SSD_RESET_CONN_L? SSD_RESET_CONN_L is a signal that goes to the SSD that will put it in RESET mode which will keep it from working, when SSD_RESET_L is present. _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message:
Initially no fan spin, 33mA draw and very clean board except slight corrosion around <RESISTOR>R7611</RESISTOR>, cleaned up and got fan spin but left with flashing folder.

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>    3.4v
ppbusg3h.       8.9v

draws 780mA

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.09v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>   5.3v


<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>                     3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PWRFAIL_WARN_L</SIGNAL>         0v
<SIGNAL>SSD_PCIE_SEL_L</SIGNAL>                    0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_OOBI1_R2D_CONN_L</SIGNAL>   3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_OOBI_D2R_CONN_L</SIGNAL>     3.3v
<SIGNAL>P1V05_S0_VREF</SIGNAL>                1.8v
<SIGNAL>P1V05S0_FB</SIGNAL>                    1.05v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>                   1.05
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL>                   3.3v
<SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>                   0v
<SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_CONN_L</SIGNAL>        0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3SSD_VMON</SIGNAL>        1.02v
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL>        3.3v

<CHIP>U3740</CHIP> OR-gate seems suspect to me with OR -gate input pins 6 at 3.3v and pin7 at 0v and output pin 8 at 0v (but another 00165 board I have gives same result)

I can boot from high Sierra or El Capitan install media on USB drive but cannot see internal SSD in disk util.

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U3740</CHIP> OR-gate seems suspect to me with OR -gate input pins 6 at 3.3v and pin7 at 0v and output pin 8 at 0v (but another 00165 board I have gives same result)"
Zoom in the pdf and look at OR gate input corresponding to pin 6...

"<SIGNAL>SMC_PWRFAIL_WARN_L</SIGNAL>         0v"
Can you compare with good board?
I expect 0V to mean failure; signal name ends in "_L".

Possibly corroded traces, or components related with SSD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PWRFAIL_WARN_L</SIGNAL>  is also 0v on another board I have so I think I will assume this is normal.

Wow well spotted, after I zoomed to 800% I can see the negation!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message:
Compare diode mode to ground on all SSD lines, with good board.
Do it with the same SSD connected in both.
Don't forget to check on both side of <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17 and <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11 data pines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground on exposed pins 53 to 29 of SSD connector are similar between two boards using same SSD.
Pin53 to pin29 reading (dashes separate the pins) 0-.4-.4-0-OL-.4-.4-0-.4-.4-0-.4-.4-0-0-.4-.4-0-.4-.4-0-0-.04-.04-0
My other board had very similar values with only pin 52 varying slightly to 0.7v

Visual inspection of <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>-17 and <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>/11 are all clear of corrosion and chip VCC good. <CHIP>U3710</CHIP> AND gate had 0.65 on both inputs and 0v on output.
<CHIP>U3711</CHIP> AND gate had 3.3v on inputs and 3.3v on output

So still wondering where the problem is.
What is the purpose of signals <SIGNAL>SMC_OOB1_R2D_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_OOB1_D2R_L</SIGNAL> ?

BTW I know Ive asked this about iMacs but will all Apple notebooks when powered, fan spinning  present video on their thunderbolt ports when the LCD is not connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message: Once external monitor is detected, external video is enabled.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message: Will the external monitor be detected if the OS is not booted?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message:
The connector has hot plug detect capability (HPD) for display port.
Detection is done by hardware.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins, flashing folder, tried good SSDs, not seen by diskutil
threads.message:
I bet for PCH internal damage.
<RESISTOR>R7611</RESISTOR> is on the feedback loop for <SIGNAL>1V05_S0</SIGNAL>.
If its value increases, output voltage goes high; an overvoltage occured, because of corrosion...
